Energy balance¶

class energy.Enthalpy(model, momentum, solve_params=None, transient=False, use_lat_bc=False, energy_flux_mode='Fb', stabilization_method='GLS')[source]¶
calc_PE(avg=False)[source]¶

calculates the grid P’{e}clet number to self.model.PE.

if avg=True, calculate the vertical average.

calc_T_melt(annotate=False)[source]¶

Calculates temperature melting point model.T_melt and energy melting point model.theta_melt.

calc_basal_temperature_flux()[source]¶

Solve for the basal temperature flux stored in model.gradT_B.

calc_basal_temperature_melting_flux()[source]¶

Solve for the basal temperature melting flux stored in model.gradTm_B.

calc_temp_rat()[source]¶

calculates the ratio of the temperate zone, saved to model.temp_rat.

calc_temperate_thickness()[source]¶

calculates the temperate zone thickness, saved to model.alpha_int.

calc_vert_avg_W()[source]¶

calculates the vertical averge water content W, saved to model.Wbar.

calc_vert_avg_strain_heat()[source]¶

calculates integrated strain-heating, saved to model.Qbar.

default_solve_params()[source]¶

Returns a set of default solver parameters that yield good performance

derive_temperate_zone(annotate=False)[source]¶

Solve the steady-state energy equation, saving enthalpy to model.theta, temperature to model.T, and water content to model.W such that the regions with overlying temperate ice are properly marked by model.alpha.

get_solve_params()[source]¶

Returns the solve parameters.

initialize(model, momentum, solve_params=None, transient=False, use_lat_bc=False, energy_flux_mode='Fb', stabilization_method='GLS', reset=False)[source]¶

Set up energy equation residual.

mark_temperate_zone()[source]¶

mark basal regions with overlying temperate layer to model.alpha.

solve(annotate=False)[source]¶

Solve the energy equations, saving enthalpy to model.theta, temperature to model.T, and water content to model.W.

solve_basal_melt_rate()[source]¶

Solve for the basal melt rate stored in model.Mb.

solve_divide(init=False, annotate=False)[source]¶
update_thermal_parameters(annotate=False)[source]¶

fixed-point iterations to make all linearized thermal parameters consistent.
